alert.note: Alert for Concho; Menard; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 1:10AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Tom Green, northwestern Menard and Concho Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 108 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms from northeastern Tom Green County into southern Concho County, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paint Rock, Eden, Lowake, Orient, Mereta, Veribest, Vancourt, Eola, Millersview, Live Oak, Harriet, and rural areas of eastern Tom Green and Concho counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
